reviews.review:
[h1] Introduction [/h1]

This game is both a blessing and a curse at the same time but overall, I would say it is a pretty good game and you won't find anythign that is similar to it in terms of quality and gameplay. So basically as a survivor you can play for the goal of escaping, with a build that is focused on surviving until the exit gates are powered or well you could also play a fun build which is what I recommend. A build in which you try to save everyone else, or become a distraction so that others can focus on repairing gens or you could also make a ninja build that is hard to keep track of for the killer or even a gen rush build. The think is, than rather than play to win, you should play to have fun and try different things, not using the same build forever.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

I seen survivors playing mostly for the sake of winning and their experiences always remain, for the most part the same. Survive, power up gens/wait until others do so, escape. I think all of your survivors should have different builds and focused on their own goals so that you can drawn the most fun out of that aspect.

As for killers, this is the most fun and main attraction of the game. The amount of choices you have with them is insane and even an individual killer can embrace so many crazy combinations that it is nuts. Survivors pale in comparison to killers but I think this is a good thing as killers had to prepare themselves for a 1 vs 4 as well as being the antagonist so to speak. You get a good variety of killers, which are each focused on certain playstyles from the get-go but you can also customize them to your own needs. This adds a huge replayability factor when playing as them and actually makes you think for yourself in which other way you could play them as well as how to improve on your own playstyle.

[h1] Some Notes [/h1]

I think the blessing aspect I mentioned before is that the game can be a lot of fun and enjoyable if you play it with the goal of having a good time and improving yourself as well as trying new things and stuff that may sound bad on paper but surprisingly works well in-game.

As for the curse, well, if you play to win, to be among the best, prepare to rage hard. Because sometimes so matches can be ruthless. Some killers may camp you if you make them mad at you by making them lose time, looping them, or provoking them(as well as making gens fast) and some survivors will finish the match real soon as well as make you lose time should you tunnel them, and if you don't tunnel them they will direct their team in such an effective way that it will be hard to even kill 1 or 2 of them. Particulary if they are a premade party.

That being said, camping tends to be a rare occurence since it penalizes the killer in two ways, one is that it rewards them with less BloodPoints, which is the in-game earned currency to level up characters and gain abilties. And two, camping gives all other 3 survivors plenty of time to do gens and escape if they are smart. 

[h1] Sum Up [/h1]

+ Good amount of variety to keep the player entertained.
+ Updates are frequent and always bring new playstyles to the game.
+ Optimaztion is good.
+ Is unique among it's peers.

- Rank system is not the best.
- Takes a while to get the good perks that everyone is running.
- Getting all the DLC can be expensive.
- Your experience can sometimes be ruined by other players.

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

Dead by Daylight is a fun game to play whenever you play with randoms or friends (is better with friends) you have a lot of options to try both in builds and characters and the experience never gets dull. optimazation is great even through the game is capped at 60 FPS and the learning curve is steep but enjoyable. Your experience is in part define by your teammates and enemies so some matches will be fun while others won't.

I really like the game, the gameplay is fun and the idea of it is nice over all, besides it having some bugs.
What really bothers me is that the Killers have it way too easy to get all the survivors killed.
Many perks are unfair, especially nearly every Killer is too fast, the "new" ones, including even the Hag and Michael are way too OP. In my opinion, its pretty unbalanced, I hope the developers will change that some say.

If you don't have any friends who own the game and wanna play with you, you nearly have no chance of surviving, so I cannot recommend it for you if you don't wanna play a Killer and be unfair.

Awesome game. Fun to play. My only complaint is the Auric Shards. Basically the only way to buy the cool items and those shards are bought with real money. But since it's all cosmetic anyway, it doesnt really effect the gameplay and the game is still solid.

So first off I did not play this game till much after it was released, so I don't know if the comments regarding the games imbalances are from an early state of the game or not, but it is very fun.
Each killer plays differently, and the survivors have their own unique perks to keep them alive.
the maps are pretty random each time you play though the trapdoor spawns in the same spot I think.
That being said, it does have a VERY toxic community at times, with people often using you as bait when you are a survivor, or being a general nuisance when you are the killer. But if you can accept the fact that these sad people are in every single multiplayer game in creation, you should be able to enjoy this game.
Also be prepared to be called a camper, cheat, hacker, and any other term you can think of for cheater when you win against people because you are smart and use your killer's abilities to their fullest( such as traping pallets and survivors as the Trapper, using the teleport traps as the Hag, and so on).

dbd is over magic games

This game is a 4.99-9.99 game for people who dont like balance roulette rounds that are either hit or miss because you have no idea what perks your killer has. Or for those that dont like to grind endlessly for characters via blood points. 4.99 if you can wait long enough. 20 dollars? LMAO. No. Just...No.

Its full price for those that love the grind and the perk/exploit scene. For those that love to exploit silly and gamebreaking perks and powers that are put in for killer handholding purposes. Killers get insta spotting powers, ruin hexes (breaks game on smaller levels entirely), and basically i win perks that makes players just either DC or end the game by giving up. 

When you design a game around a perk system it makes the game all about finding the exploit perks only. The game was by far better when  you had survivors and killers, PERIOD. The skills/perk system just muddies the water too much. Now all the Pros spam RUIN and the lamest hexes that force survivors to go totem hunting. And they do it for the SOLE purpose of just extending his "find the survivors early" time. Because survivors start near gennies and get quick times to start them. Large map? Much harder to execute w/ ruin and other hexes and better balanced. Small map? LMAO. You'll be lucky if half your team doesn't DC INSTANTLY! Or throw the match by just letting the killer win. Its a joke.

Graphics? 2008 

Graphics settings? None. Low, medium, high and ultra. And that's it. Eveyrone plays low because its eaisier to see. Config file changes? Ignored entirely.

Can't disable AA w/o turning game to low settings. LMAO. Everyone plays them because it is advantageous. Things are by far clearer.

Too dark? Up your gamma. Lots of people do it.

Hackers? Probably a lot of them. Hard to know for sure. All you need is a wall hack. Plenty of exploiters though. 

Sound? Can't turn off music. 

Controls aren't bad. Gennies zones aren't bad to hit, but with Hex ruin too hard on survivors to hit and only there to hold the killers hands.

Beyond that, its a fuck around and a griefers paradise only. Grinding just keeps people playing and keeps the game on the steam stats list longer and therefore makes gamers think its "good". 

Its fun, yes, but not for long. But dont do the ranked matches. This game is not ESPORTs like the devs want it to be. Coming back to it after a time makes replaying an "i remember what i hated about this" kind of experience. Not fun long term, after you spot the flaws.
